Hi Mary, 
Here are some articles found on ICMA’s website that include case studies showing how emotional intelligence helped to predict or explain an employee or supervosir’s ability to be successful. 
•    Do You Know What Your Emotional IQ Is? Explores how knowing employees emotional IQs can help to determine if an employee will make a good supervisor and how to work on emotional development within your organization. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/2664 
•   Here is a perviosuly answered question about Emotional Intellegence and how other local government officials are using this concept in their workplaces. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22297
I hope these articles give you some insight into emotional IQ and hiring and promoting employees. If anyone else has first hand experiences to contribute please do! 
Best,
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA’s Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: David Donaldson
answers.text:
Mary:  My approach has been to try to ask questions and evaluate answers through the five key traits of emotional intelligence: Empathy, Motivation, Reaction to Stress, Social Skills, and Self Awareness.  This includes questions like “How do you think other people experience you?”, Tell me about a time when you were able to put yourself in another’s place to understand their position before you made an important decision?  How would your coworkers say you react to stress? What would they notice different in your behavior?  What do you try to moderate or minimize when you are under stress?  Who are your best friends at work and what are the relationships based upon? If you could attend a full day seminar in an area to improve your skills at work, what subject would you chose? Tell us about a time when you made a decision and it was misinterpreted?  Tell us about the best day you have had at work and what happened that day?  Tell us about the traits of the best manager you have ever worked for and examples of how you have embraced those traits.  Same question for worst with rejecting instead of embracing. You can use some of these same questions as you talk with references and compare the responses.
Hope that is helpful.
David Donaldson
Assistant City Manager
City of Lake Oswego

Lake Oswego, OR 97034
